description: Rich, smoky and with powerful fruit, this structured wine also has an impressive perfumed character. Spice, blackberry fruits and rich tannins give wonderful firmness that will allow the wine to age well. Drink this already beautiful wine from 2025.
title: Château Cheval Blanc 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: From an always-impressive estate, this vintage is superb, offering big tannins plus but also generous black fruits and powerful ripeness. Dense and with a good structure for aging, the wine will develop slowly and will not be ready before 2026.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine has a fresh, bubbly personality that's complemented by complex, earthy undertones of rose and forest floor. The tannins offer grip to the palate, adding texture and weight within a framework of balanced acidity.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Iris, perfumed berry, baking-spice and tilled earth aromas mingle with scents of crushed herb. Polished and structured, the smooth, full-bodied palate delivers creamy cherry, raspberry, cinnamon and a hint of star anise alongside taut elegant tannins while fresh acidity lends balance. It's tantalizingly delicious.
title: Il Colle 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: A perennial knockout, this wine combines vineyard sites from its namesake Westside Road. Flavors of smoke, strawberry, forest floor and black tea accent a velvety, lush palate, ending with a fresh, savory edge.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The famous wine lives up to its mighty reputation in this vintage. Densely packed in tones of red currant, cassis and cocoa powder, the palate offers a sublime texture that lingers despite an overall powerful punch of structure and tannin. Elements of crushed rock and black licorice unfold on the finish. Enjoy from 2024–2034.
title: Shafer 2014 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: This is a head-turning wine, especially at the price—an impressive study in cohesive elements of black currant, lavender and licorice melded with meaty, lengthy tannin. The black currant gives way to more sumptuous flavors of blueberry and cocoa powder, offering balanced body weight and complexity.
title: Turnbull 2016 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: A warm wine rich in tannins and with succulent berry fruits, this is both powerful and elegant. Its density doesn't detract from the fruitiness that shines out of the wine and balances with the structured aging potential. Drink the wine from 2025.
title: Château la Gaffelière 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: While this wine's tannins are powerful. they are buried in a surprisingly soft texture of rich black fruits. With both structure and ripe blackberry flavors, the wine is already balanced. A juicy aftertaste lifts the tannins, pushing the wine into greatness. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Montrose 2016  Saint-Estèphe

description: As often with this estate, this wine combines opulent richness and an elegant structure. It is a bold wine, ripe and full of black fruits. But it holds together impressively, with nothing in excess. The wine will age well; drink from 2025.
title: Château Pichon Longueville 2016  Pauillac

description: Dark tannins work with the sophisticated structure of this wine. The very fine tannins are an important element of the wine, giving shape to the ripe black fruits and acidity. This wine, rich and structured, is set for a long development. Drink from 2026.
title: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2016  Margaux

description: Juicy, spicy and with wonderful fruit, this is developing splendidly. With black-currant flavors and tannins that give structure while allowing plenty of room for the fruit and balanced acidity, it is certain to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Valandraud 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: As so often with this estate, this is a generous, opulent wine. This year a strong tannic element gives the wine a good structure. Smoky, textured and powerful, it needs many years to mature. Do not drink this wine before 2026.
title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: Made by the winemaking team of Canon la Gaffelière, this wine is stylishly elegant, restrained in its structure and tannins. Its intensely juicy character is already attractive, giving the wine almost a refreshing character. This balanced wine will be ready from 2025.
title: La Mondotte 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: All you need is a few swirls of the glass to release the perfumed aromas of wild berry, forest floor, new leather and crushed herb. The palate shows precision and finesse, offering red cherry, cranberry, baking spice and tobacco set against taut refined tannins and bright acidity. It's still youthfully austere but will bloom with more bottle aging. Drink 2023–2038.
title: Mastrojanni 2013 Vigna Schiena d'Asino  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Dr. Crane delivers rewarding complexity and contour within a framework of firm, substantial tannins and stark structure. Leather, grilled meat and gunpowder complement tangy layers of acid-driven cassis and red currant, combining effortlessly in a seamless array of evolving flavors and aromas. The minerality takes form in a sensation of crushed rock. Enjoy from 2025–2035.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: The Bonnie family's estate has produced a richly structured wine, full of the ripe tannins indicative of the vintage. To balance the structure, powerful flavors of black currant and dark berries give ripeness. It is a wine to age; drink after 2026.
title: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: This release underlines this estate's change in style towards more elegant wines. While concentrated, the wine has stylish layers of black-plum fruit, beautiful acidity and freshness. Black-chocolate flavors are fully integrated into the rich tannins. This will develop into a great wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Pavie 2016  Saint-Émilion

description: There is beautiful concentration on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, combining aromas of candied black raspberry and ripe cherry with hints of cinnamon and warm coffee cake. It's explosive on the palate, with a bursting boysenberry flavor that's rounded out by star anise, vanilla and rose petals, yet the structure remains lithe and tight.
title: Clarice 2017 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Crushed herb, woodland berry, camphor, rose and pipe tobacco are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. The sleek structured palate is all about finesse, evoking juicy Marasca cherry, pomegranate, red orange, white pepper and star anise set against taut refined tannins. It has great energy and balance, thanks to vibrant acidity that also lends an ageworthy structure. Drink 2021–2033.
title: Il Colle 2013  Brunello di Montalcino
